intro: Aneulophus africanus, commonly known as the African leaf roller, is a species of moth belonging to the family Tortricidae. It is characterized by its small size and the distinctive patterns on its wings, which often resemble leaves, aiding in camouflage. The larvae of this species feed on the leaves of various plants, primarily in the regions of Africa. The plant's botanical significance lies in its role as a host plant for the larvae, contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat. Its presence is often indicative of the health and diversity of the surrounding flora.
